other_tests.findings: The biopsy revealed aggregates of histiocytic cells with moderate amounts of eosinophilic, slightly granular cytoplasm and deeply folded, C-shaped nuclei with indistinct nucleoli, associated with numerous eosinophils and occasional mature lymphocytes. Areas of necrosis were present.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient's headache and double vision on left lower gaze improved over a period of two to three weeks as the dose of corticosteroid was tapered, and his condition became stable.
